description: Future tenses, plans, predictions, and future time expressions

sentences.english: I will call you when I arrive.
sentences.explanation: Future tense in both clauses with 'quand'. 'T'appellerai' and 'j'arriverai' both use future simple.

sentences.english: She is going to study medicine next year.
sentences.explanation: Near future with 'aller' + infinitive. 'Va étudier' = is going to study.

sentences.english: By 2030, technology will have changed everything.
sentences.explanation: Future perfect: 'aura changé'. 'D'ici 2030' = by 2030. Completed future action.

sentences.english: We might go to Spain this summer.
sentences.explanation: 'Peut-être' expresses possibility. 'Irons' = will go (future simple of aller).

sentences.english: I hope the weather will be nice tomorrow.
sentences.explanation: 'Espérer que' + future. 'Il fera beau' = weather will be nice. Hope expressions.

sentences.english: He will have finished his work by 6 PM.
sentences.explanation: Future perfect: 'aura fini'. 'Avant 18 heures' = by 6 PM. Completion deadline.

sentences.english: They will probably buy a new house.
sentences.explanation: 'Probablement' = probably. 'Achèteront' = will buy (future simple). Probability.

sentences.english: If you study hard, you will succeed.
sentences.explanation: Type 1 conditional: Si + present + future. Cause and effect relationship.

sentences.english: In the future, cars will be electric.
sentences.explanation: 'À l'avenir' = in the future. 'Seront' = will be. Future predictions.

sentences.english: We are about to leave for the airport.
sentences.explanation: 'Être sur le point de' = to be about to. Immediate future action.

sentences.english: I think robots will replace many jobs.
sentences.explanation: 'Penser que' + future. Opinion about future developments. Technology impact.

sentences.english: She will be working while we are on vacation.
sentences.explanation: Future simple expressing simultaneous actions. 'Pendant que' = while.

sentences.english: This time next week, I will be in Paris.
sentences.explanation: Future time reference. 'À cette heure' = at this time. Specific future moment.

sentences.english: Once he graduates, he will look for a job.
sentences.explanation: 'Une fois que' + future perfect + future simple. Sequential future actions.

sentences.english: I doubt they will arrive on time.
sentences.explanation: 'Douter que' + subjunctive (arrivent). Doubt expressions require subjunctive.

sentences.english: The meeting is scheduled for next Tuesday.
sentences.explanation: 'Être prévu pour' = to be scheduled for. Formal planning expressions.

sentences.english: By the time you read this, I will have left.
sentences.explanation: 'Quand' + future + future perfect. 'Serai parti' = will have left.

sentences.english: I wonder what life will be like in 50 years.
sentences.explanation: 'Se demander comment' = to wonder how. Future speculation about distant time.

sentences.english: She promises she will be more careful.
sentences.explanation: 'Promettre que' + future. Promise about future behavior change.

sentences.english: We will have been married for 10 years next month.
sentences.explanation: 'Cela fera X temps que' = it will have been X time since. Duration expression.
